resources.string: Set the number of characters to display
Set the number of digits to display in the pair
Set the number of rows to display

Vision Expand Help

Vision Expand is a peripheral vision enhancement exercise. By improving peripheral vision your reading speed and detail perception should improve. Good peripheral vision is not only helpful at increasing reading speed but is useful for safer driving of a motor vehicle.

The exercise may be adjusted to start from your acceptable vision width and slowly increase the characters displayed to gradually increase peripheral span from 3 to 8 characters. The flash rate may also be adjusted to allow for a varied length of viewable time.

To get the most from the exercise you should view the text from the center and attempt to see all the numerals. With time you should be able to see more characters accurately at a greater expanse. There may be some eye strain to begin with; this will improve as the eyes become more capable to see a wider field of vision.

Remember to relax and not strain or force improvement too rapidly. It is natural to make mistakes attempting to recall what you saw, this is the purpose of the exercise to improve and have a successful outcome.

Vision Expand Help

You can configure the following by accessing Settings from the main screen or through the menu button.

Flash period:
Period for displaying content

Display Characters:
Number of Charactes to be displayed

Display Rows:
Rows of characters that will be displayed

Display Digits:
Number of digits that will be presented on the Challenger exercise. Each number in the pair will have the specific number of digits.

Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)

What is Flash period?
Flash period is the time period the information will be flashed on the screen. It is represented as seconds or milliseconds in Vision Expand. Milliseconds is one thousandth of a second. So if you select lower milliseconds the time period the information is shown will be very short.

Can I configure more than one row in Challenger?
No. You cannot configure. Challenger only allows one row of information.

How can I view more wider text?
If you tilt to landscape mode, the information width will increase thus giving you a more wider area to practice your exercises. This will help you expand your peripheral vision quite wider enough to read a whole line of text in a novel in one fixation when properly practiced.

How do I know whether the answer entered was correct or incorrect?
When you enter the correct answer, the blue bar where the information is displayed will flash green and then flash the next practice information. If its an incorrect answer, then it will flash red instead of green.

This level may be adjusted from 3 to 8 digits, allowing you to exercise your vision span by flashing the numerals on the screen which you must remember and enter correctly. As you improve you will be able to view more characters at the same time and decrease the flash time as well. This helps improve your peripheral vision gradually so you may view more information to help improve your focus and reading speed. As you advance you may also configure the numerals to two rows. Once you start, wait for the numbers to be flashed, remember them and enter. If you have entered correctly the numeral background will flash green if incorrectly it will flash red.

This exercise level may be adjusted to 2 or 3 pairs of flashing numerals which will expand according to the correct responses; increasing peripheral vision and focus. Repeated incorrect entries will cause the pairs to contract to a shorter distance until you are able to enter correctly at the expanded width.
If you enjoy using this app, please take a moment to rate it. Thanks for your support!
